Description: Bowl sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery small chalice with top of stem; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black with two added white bands; exterior, from top: hook maeander band between lines; band; rays.
Curator's comments: Lemos places the sherd within the Chalice Style, however, the decoration on the cul of Chalice Style vases typically consists of simple bands. Hooked maeander patterns and rising rays do not feature on Chalice Style vases. They are, however, commonly found on the earlier Wild Goat Style chalices. Furthermore, whilst some Chalice Style vases lack interior decoration, it is the norm on Wild Goat Style vessels. For parallels, see the Würzburg chalices (Lemos no. 236-237).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 302, no.1098)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0103) (phase 2)
